AE.Display.Animation2d.group#

class AE.Display.Animation2d.group(animation, name, **kwargs)#

Bases: item, QGraphicsItemGroup

Group item

A group item has no representation upon display but serves as a parent for multiple other items in order to create and manipulate composed objects.

__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)#

Group item constructor

Defines a group, which inherits both from QGraphicsItemGroup and item.

Parameters:

  • animation (Animaton2d) – The animation container.

  • name (str) – The item’s identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a reference by Animation2d. This is the only mandatory argument.

  • parent (QGraphicsItem) – The parent QGraphicsItem in the QGraphicsScene. Default is None, which means the parent is the QGraphicsScene itself.

  • zvalue (float) – Z-value (stack order) of the item.

  • position ([float,float]) – Position of the group, text, circle, and rectangle elements (scene units).

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of the item (rad)

  • clickable (bool) – TO DO

  • movable (bool) – If True, the element will be draggable. (default: False)

itemChange(change, value)#

Item change notification

This method is triggered upon item change. The item’s transformation matrix has changed either because setTransform is called, or one of the transformation properties is changed. This notification is sent if the ItemSendsGeometryChanges flag is enabled (e.g. when an item is item.movable), and after the item’s local transformation matrix has changed.

Parameters:

change (QGraphicsItem constant) –

move(dx=None, dy=None, z=None)#

Relative displacement

Displaces the item of relative amounts.

dx#

\(x\)-coordinate of the displacement. It can also be a doublet [dx,`dy`], in this case the dy argument is overridden.

Type:

float

dy#

\(y\)-coordinate of the displacement.

Type:

float

z#

A complex number \(z = dx+jdy\). Specifying z overrides the x and y arguments.

Type:

float

group.moveBy(self, float, float)

opaqueArea(self) → QPainterPath#

parentWidget(self) → QGraphicsWidget#
place()#

Absolute positionning

Places the item at an absolute position.

x#

\(x\)-coordinate of the new position. It can also be a doublet [x,``y``], in this case the y argument is overridden.

Type:

float

y#

\(y\)-coordinate of the new position.

Type:

float

z#

A complex number \(z = x+jy\). Specifying z overrides the x and y arguments.

Type:

float

setStyle()#

Item styling

This function does not take any argument, instead it applies the changes defined by each item’s styling attributes (e.g. color, stroke thickness).
